Hey there folks, welcome to the world of programming
Task-1.
Print Hello World to the console using the pre-built print function

Now lets focus on variables
Unlike other programming languages, Python has no command for declaring a variable.A variable is created the moment you first assign a value to it.
Also consider these variable naming conventions

1.A variable name must start with a letter or the underscore character
2.A variable name cannot start with a number
3.A variable name can only contain alpha-numeric characters and underscores (A-z, 0-9, and _ )
3.Variable names are case-sensitive (age, Age and AGE are three different variables)
Task-2
Consider these variable names:-
variable
sum@
product_of_12
12_product
Just print out the correct variable names in order

Keep it up!
Strings represent a group of characters.String literals in python are surrounded by either single quotation marks, or double quotation marks.Python provides various prebuilt functions to deal with strings, say to find the length of a string, convert it to lower case etc.

 Operators are used to perform operations on variables and values. 
 There are many types of operators: 
 1. Arithmetic Operator 
 2. Assignment Operator 
 3. Comparison Operator 
 4. Logical Operator 
 5. Bitwise Operator
